Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed very streaky black (mostly worn) below; at bottom of sherd, trace of two added white bands; exterior reserved with single black band near bottom of sherd.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The sherd joins Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA88. Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior. Given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 302, pl. 152) (Number not stated (possibly no. 1106))
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1210) (phase 2)
